dt.t: … leaving aside variations {wi}accountable{/wi} as printer's errors …

pt: {sc}responsible{/sc} {sc}answerable{/sc} {sc}accountable{/sc} {sc}amenable{/sc} {sc}liable{/sc} mean subject to being held to account. {sc}responsible{/sc} implies holding a specific office, duty, or trust.
{sc}answerable{/sc} suggests a relation between one having a moral or legal obligation and a court or other authority charged with oversight of its observance.
{sc}accountable{/sc} suggests imminence of retribution for unfulfilled trust or violated obligation.

pt.t: elected officials are {it}accountable{/it} to the voters

pt: {sc}amenable{/sc} and {sc}liable{/sc} stress the fact of subjection to review, censure, or control by a designated authority under certain conditions.

pt.t: not {it}liable{/it} for the debts of the former spouse

et: Middle English {it}accountable, accomptable{/it}, borrowed from Anglo-French {it}acomptable{/it}, from {it}acunter{/it} "to {et_link|account:2|account:2}" + {it}-able{/it} {et_link|-able|-able}
shortdef: subject to giving an account : answerable
